PARISH CELL GROUPS

(Posted August 2015)


What are Parish Cells?

Next parish cell meetings:
  • Wed 4th Feb 2015
  • Wed 25th Feb 2015
  • Wed 11th March 2015
  • Wed 25th march 2015

This parish is one of the many parishes in Ireland benefiting from the Parish Cells experience. Why not visit a Parish Cell this year? You will be glad you did!

Parish cell groups meet in a number of parishioners homes on a fortnightly basis, usually on a Wednesday night at 8pm.

Everyone welcome.

If you would like to visit or take part in a cell please contact:

Margaret Webb
Tel: 07779729505  
Email: mags.webb@virgin.net

"Lord, we give You thanks for the beautiful gift of life you have given us."

THE PARISH HOSTED NATIONAL CELL SEMINARS IN 2011 and 2012


Click here for more photographs

CENTERING PRAYER

(Posted January 2015)

Centering Prayer Support Group

Next meeting:

Sunday 25th January 2015 @ 7pm
in St. Nicholas' Church
Minorca Place, Carrickfergus

"The deepest communion with God comes through silence. There is a form of prayer where we do nothing, where we sit in stillness and silence. We abandon all words and reflection and we rest. We put ourselves in God’s hands and wait in silence to let God’s Spirit pray in us".

('Your Hidden Treasure' by Benignus O’Rourke)

For more information please contact:

Patsy Bell
Tel: 9336 8043
Mobile: 07773038159
Email: p.bell91@yahoo.co.uk

or

Also see contemplativeoutreach.ie

DOWN & CONNOR 'LIVING CHURCH' OFFICE OPEN FOR BUSINESS NEW WEBSITE LAUNCHED

(Posted May 2012)

In 2010 Bishop Treanor initiated the start of the 'Living Church' journey with the council of priests as together they began to explore the vision and way forward for the Diocese. From the outset of the process it was recognised that there was a need to listen and Fr Alan McGuckian was engaged in creating a listening forum for the Priests of the Diocese and from this came the resounding message to listen to religious & laity.

The commitment of the Diocese to the 'Living Church'is confirmed by the establishment of the 'Living Church' office who are charged with implementing the recommendations of the 'Living Church' report and preparing a 5 year Diocesan Pastoral Plan which will be presented at the Diocesan Congress in 2013.

Click here to visit the 'Living Church Website'

See also the NEW Down and Connor Living Youth website!

CHRISTMAS FAMILY DAY

The YPC are holding a Christmas Family Day in St Nicholas’ hall on Sunday 9th December directly after 11:30 Mass.

Children can make tree decorations and Christmas crafts, while the adults can enjoy music, snacks, hot drinks and browse for gift ideas.

We’re even expecting a special visit from Santa!

We will be selling Christmas cards which are hand made, as well as gifts, food and Trocaire’s Global Gifts. All proceeds are in aid of Trocaire, SVdP and the Capuchen Day Centre for the homeless in Dublin

INTER-CHURCH PRAYER & FELLOWSHIP MEETING

The next bi-monthly meeting is planned for Tuesday 4 December 8 pm

St Nicholas’ RC Church
with by Fr Anthony Curran.

Tea, coffee and mince pies provided. Everyone welcome.

Greenisland’s monthly prayer fellowship is normally on the first Monday, rotating among the Methodist, Presbyterian, St Colman’s RC and Church of the Holy Name (C of I) - please confirm dates with your minister.

THE WEEK OF PRAYER FOR CHRISTIAN UNITY

18th -25th January 2013

hosted in:

GATEWAY CHURCH, CARRICKFERGUS
Tuesday 22nd January 2013
8pm

This year the Week of Prayer for Christian Unity came to us born out of the great injustices against the marginalized, politically under-represented, economically exploited and culturally subjugated Christian Dalit’s that make up almost 80% of Indian Christians in South India. They have reflected upon their own context and offer to us a theme that calls us to respond to the obligations to act justly in the world taken from Micah 6.6-8. Our focus for prayer meditations and worship liturgy material was adapted by Churches Together in Britain and Ireland. 

Visit the Churches Together in Britain and Ireland website: http://ctbi.org.uk/

Local clergy and worship team led our united congregations in a celebration of our Christian Unity.

PATHWAYS - EXPLORING LIFE, FAITH AND MINISTRY

(Posted Agust 2012)

Pathways is a two-year diocesan adult faith development programme held in Drumalis Retreat Centre, Larne, which runs from October to June each year. It offers space for reflection and discussion about life, faith and ministry. It is held monthly on nine Saturdays from 10am - 4:30pm.

Enrolling now for 2012 to 2014 intake.

For further information

Tel: 028 28272196 or 028 28276455

or

Email: maura@drumalis.co.uk
